page.title: 09Farm Survey (cont)
page.content:
School Farm is run as a separate business and is for the production of beef.
On Wednesday 3rd July we visited Holbury Farm. This is a farm of 8500 pigs and 3200 sheep. The farmer chose pigs because they are very profitable and the sheep are suited to the poor grazing land. The pig's food is made up of barley, wheat, soya bean meal, mids (a by-product of flour), fishmeal, minerals and vitamins. All this is crushed in the farms own mill and made into small pellets. A sow has five litters in 2.5 years before she is slaughtered. There are two sorts of pigs on the farm: Landrace and Large Whites. The most common diseases on a pig farm are pneumonia, and swine fever. Sheep can get footrot, maggots in the fleece,...
